title.narrative: GOVERNMENT SYSTEMS ARE STRENGTHENED TO ENABLE UNIVERSAL ACCESS TO Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES

description.narrative: Government systems are strengthened to enable universal access to Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Households in rural and urban areas have increased access to safe, â€œbasicâ€ and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in emergency and non- emergencysituations.

sector.narrative: Overall WASH – systems strengthening (e.g. sector-wide coordination, enabling environment and financing advocacy)
Water sector policy and administrative management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government systems are strengthened to enable universal access to WASH services

description.narrative: During 2021, UNICEF continued to provide technical assistance to the government in the operationalization of the WASH MIS. The system was operationalized in 13 additional districts, bringing the total number of districts collecting baseline data and feeding to MIS to 30. Work on development of the WASH sector financing strategy also began.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/12/2021
